The Numbers

Lancaster City Council's spending data reveals £141.4 million in external payments across 24,593 transactions with 1,785 unique suppliers spanning financial years 2021/22 to 2025/26.

As the largest district council in Lancashire by population (144,246 residents), Lancaster's annual spend of approximately £35.4 million per year works out at £245 per resident annually in external payments over £500.

Where the Money Goes

The top five suppliers account for 17.4% of total expenditure:

SupplierTotalShare
Preston City Council£7.5M5.3%
West Dunbartonshire Council£5.0M3.5%
Npower Commercial Gas£4.6M3.3%
EMCOR Group£4.1M2.9%
Eden Project Morecambe£3.5M2.5%

Lancaster has one of the lowest supplier concentration levels in Lancashire with an HHI score of just 118.4, indicating a competitive and diverse supplier base. No single supplier dominates spending.

Data Coverage

Lancaster publishes spending data from 2021/22, though there is a gap in 2022/23 data. All records include dates, supplier names, and department classifications — achieving 100% transparency across all three metrics.

Explore the full dataset on our Spending page, or see our DOGE Investigation for deeper analysis.
